audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: This is process optimization (faster ad creation), not business model transformation. Stitch Fix's core value proposition remains unchanged.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific metrics (77% pass rate, 2 weeks to 1 minute) but this is operational efficiency, not strategic transformation.
audited_claims.notes: Clear Tier 1 case - operational improvement in marketing processes, not transformation

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Automating ad generation is process improvement, not business model change. The advertising function remains the same - only execution is optimized.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific claim about full automation but lacks metrics on business impact.
audited_claims.notes: Tier 1 operational efficiency - AI automates existing marketing processes

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Improving personalization to increase order value is optimization of existing business model, not transformation. Stitch Fix was already a personalized styling service.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific metric (40% increase) but source quality unclear - appears to be marketing content rather than verified financial disclosure.
audited_claims.notes: Better personalization within existing model - Tier 1 optimization, not transformation

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Increasing repeat purchases through better personalization is customer retention optimization, not business model transformation.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific metric but same source quality concerns as C3.

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Revenue growth through better personalization is scaling existing model, not transforming it. Stitch Fix's business model (subscription styling boxes) remains unchanged.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific revenue figures but attribution to AI personalization alone is questionable - many factors drive revenue growth over 4 years.
audited_claims.notes: Revenue growth within existing business model - not transformation

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: AI driving 75% of selections is operational automation of existing styling process, not business model change. The core service (curated boxes) remains the same.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific percentage but unclear source authority and methodology.
audited_claims.notes: Automation of existing curation process - Tier 1 efficiency improvement

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Customer retention improvement through better personalization is optimization, not transformation of business model.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific metric (15% boost) but source quality concerns persist.

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Shop Your Looks appears to be a feature extension, not business model transformation. Still within existing e-commerce/styling framework.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Vague metric ('more than one-third') and beta-stage results have limited validation.
audited_claims.notes: Product feature addition, not business model transformation

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Cross-selling success (60% buying multiple items) is sales optimization, not business model change.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific metric but limited to beta feature performance.

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: 0.7% revenue growth is a financial performance metric, not evidence of business model transformation.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific financial metric, likely from earnings report, but minimal growth doesn't support transformation claims.
audited_claims.notes: Financial performance data - not transformation evidence

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Return to growth after declines suggests recovery/turnaround, not business model transformation.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Appears to be from earnings report but doesn't demonstrate transformation, just operational recovery.

tier_verification: This case is MISCLASSIFIED. All claims describe operational improvements, process automation, and performance optimization within Stitch Fix's existing business model (personalized styling subscription boxes). This is clearly a tier 1 case - AI is being used to do the same things better (better personalization, faster ad creation, improved retention) rather than enabling new business models or markets. The 'remove the AI' test confirms this: without AI, Stitch Fix would still be a styling service, just less efficient. This should be reclassified as tier 1.
